p: Limonene has wide applications as a flavour additive in food, beverages, fragrances, cosmetics and household products [ 63]. It is one of the most common terpenes in nature and a major constituent of numerous essential oils from Citrus. [ 64]. In genus Lippia, Limonene has been identified in Lippia turbinata Griseb. (60.60%) [ 65], Lippia alnifolia (47.20%) [ 66], Lippia alba (Mill.) N.E. Br. ex Britton and P. Wilson (30.60 to 33.00%) [ 67, 68], Lippia junelliana (Moldenke) Trunk. (23.12%) [ 65], and Lippia citriodora Kunth (syn. Aloysia citriodora Palau) (10.70%) [ 67].
